title: Damian of Pavia
text:
Damian of Pavia (also "Damianus Ticinensis, Damianus Mediolanensis, Damianus Biscossia") was <a href="Bishop%20of%20Pavia">Bishop of Pavia</a> (<a href="Ticinum">Ticinum</a>) from 680, succeeding bishop <a href="Anastasius%20of%20Pavia">Anastasius</a>. He mediated relations between the <a href="Lombards">Lombards</a> and the <a href="Byzantine%20Empire%20under%20the%20Heraclian%20dynasty">Byzantine emperors</a>.
Damian wrote a letter to emperor <a href="Constantine%20IV">Constantine IV</a> in 679 on behalf of <a href="Mansuetus%20%28bishop%20of%20Milan%29">Mansuetus</a>, archbishop of Milan, against the doctrine of <a href="Monothelitism">Monothelitism</a>. This letter, in a Latin edition, is the only extant writing from the hand of Damian (sometimes attributed to Mansuetus on whose behalf Damian was writing).
